title: Best4Soil: Crop rotation  Practical Information ET

tasks.task: Conduct crop rotation and soil health management for potato farming.
subtasks: Identify suitable crops for crop rotation to manage pests and diseases.
Analyze local conditions and disease profiles to plan crop rotations.
Rotate crops to minimize pathogen and nematode build-up in soil.
Integrate cover crops to improve soil structure and organic matter.
Use nematode-resistant and disease-tolerant potato varieties.
Rotate between different crop families to reduce pest and disease pressure.
Apply beneficial bacteria and fungi for pest and disease suppression.
Rotate between potatoes, carrot, and onion crops for effective rotations.
Consider alternative crops like buckwheat and chope as cover crops.
Manage crop residue to prevent pathogen survival.
Integrate crop rotation with other best practices for sustainable farming.
